m_gametext: ['In time, Orsa, Mother of All, was born.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['She created a companion in Her image.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['She named Him Finis, and with Him,', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Upon giving birth to Her thirteenth and', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['final child, Orsa drew Her final breath.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Finis began to weep, and weep He did...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Now, at long last...\nI have found what I seek.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['You have journeyed long\nand far to reach this place.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['First, you must learn to do battle.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['It is too soon to lay yourself to rest.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['You have yet to find\nthat which you seek, no?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['You have been chosen by this ring.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['A ring forged by the gods themselves.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["What do you seek\nat journey's end?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Flowing water to quench the thirst of need.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['And yet, one must ever be wary, lest one', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['drown in the murky waves of greed...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Traveler. If it is wealth you would have,\na formidable foe will stand before you.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Tell me...is this truly what you seek?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['You are about to commence the
Tale of Wealth from the Woodlands.
Proceed?

(*You may still play the other tales later.)', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Power——the strength to crush your foes.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['A mighty blade to triumph on the battlefield.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['And yet, in the wrong hands, the same', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['blade may be used to wound the innocent...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Traveler. If it is power you would have,\na formidable foe will stand before you.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Tell me...is this truly what you seek?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['You are about to commence the
Tale of Power from the Frostlands.
Proceed?

(*You may still play the other tales later.)', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['A banner to rally the multitudes.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Yet one with a wicked heart might also use', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['their fame to deceive and ensnare...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Traveler. If it is fame you would have,\na formidable foe will stand before you.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Tell me...is this truly what you seek?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['You are about to commence the
Tale of Fame from the Flatlands.
Proceed?

(*You may still play the other tales later.)', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Then tell me of your true desire.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Your journey\nwill not be an easy one.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Your foes, too, possess\nrings of divine power.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...each fulfilling the desires\nof the one who wears it.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Three tyrants of insatiable greed\nwho hold sway over this realm...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["For man's desire is\na bottomless abyss...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Should you seek to acquire what\nthey possess...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...they will surely stand in your way.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['You have been chosen by the ring.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Should you seek companions for your\ntravels, make your wish be known.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...and fulfill your boundless desire.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Something weighing on your mind?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['What a strange light... For a second,\nI thought it would swallow me whole.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Anyhow, what brings you to these parts?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Hm?\nDon't tell me you've come here all alone.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Should you seek companions for your\ntravels, make your wish be known.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Ah, so you had some friends after all.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Good to see it. And do you perchance have a\nname for your merry little band?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["People 'round these parts might not take so\nkindly to that name.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Would you mind thinkin' of another?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You're new to these parts, right?\nAny questions, I'm your man.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Something weighing on your mind?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['Set the Tale of Wealth as your main quest?

*If you proceed, your current
preferences will be overwritten.
You can change your main quest
any time from the Quest menu.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['Set the Tale of Fame as your main quest?

*If you proceed, your current
preferences will be overwritten.
You can change your main quest
any time from the Quest menu.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['This town has long been ruled by syndicates', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['that value blood ties and honor above all.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['and wealth threaten to consume all...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Amidst the falling snow in this remote town,', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['pious folk live quiet and humble lives.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['But it is the shadow of power that silences them,', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Theatropolis, in the Flatlands.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['It is famous for its great amphitheatre,', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['which draws audiences from far and wide.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['fame comes with great sacrifice...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['the eyes and ears of the realm on you.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['descended upon blood-red wings.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['fame comes with great sacrifice...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['and wealth threaten to consume all...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Have you heard the rumors\nabout Lady Herminia?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["They say she'd happily slaughter\nher own child for coin!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I heard she's the one who killed\noff the last of the forest people!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Horrifying... A witch who knows\nnothing but her own desires.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['And whatever she desires...\nshe gets.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Lady Herminia, "the Covetous Witch."', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Mercilessly crushing anyone who stood in her', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['way, she amassed boundless wealth.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['People whispered of her with fear, saying...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Lady Herminia.\nThe preparations for the ball are complete.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Today our luck changes.\nI'll see to that.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["We'll never even make it through\nthe front gate!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Pretty steep for a single flower.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Nothing good will come of this.\nGet out while you still can.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["But they said that if I don't sell this...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["What do you think you're doing,\nmeddling in our business!?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Those shabby clothes make\nit clear you're no customers.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You'd be wise not to judge\na book by its cover.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["...And you'd be wise to\nkeep your mouth shut.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Heh! At least we get to have some fun.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Instead of a flower, looks like\nwe've picked ourselves a fight.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Hah! Don't tell me you just\ncame to see the sights!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Or are you too scared to fight them?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["No-good scoundrels!\nYou'll pay for this!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Using children to peddle their poison,\nare they now?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Those greedy bastards!\nAlways looking down on us!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I should have stuck my dagger\nin their smug faces!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Even smug bastards are\ngood for something.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I just happened to find this\nin one of their pockets.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['A ball for fat cats\nwith fat purses...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['You really helped us out back there.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["We might look rough, but we're\nnot the bad guys here.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["We were born and raised in this town,\nand we've watched it go to shit.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["...But no more watching.\nWe're going to take it back.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['You can fight, and you look\nlike you can be trusted.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Don't be a chicken!\nI promise we're not so bad!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["A chance like this doesn't\ncome along every day.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['All right!\nA new addition to our ranks!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...And one who packs a punch.\nI have a good feeling about this.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Looks like my associates\nhave taken a liking to you.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Anyhow, we got what we came for.\nLet's leave before we make a scene.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['We rendezvous in front of the manor tonight.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Aren't you forgetting something?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['They say Lady Herminia started\nout as a small-time criminal.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Then she took control of the\npowder operation...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Rumors say she's so rich she\ncould buy the whole continent...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Not just that. Word has it she'll\neven sell her body...for a price.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["They say she's so gorgeous that even\nclergymen are reduced to dogs in heat.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["...And that she's slept with the\nthousand wealthiest men in the realm.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Wait a minute, Pierro.\nYou're saying Lady Herminia's a harlot?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I've never met a harlot who lives in a\nmansion like this.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Heh. Even prostitution can pay if you\nchoose your clients right.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['All right. Enough yapping from you lot.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Now listen. Some of the fattest cats from\nthe underworld will be at this banquet.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...Some of whom just might be able to\nhelp us get what we want.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["We're going to make a name\nfor ourselves here tonight.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Looks like the party's\nalready in full swing.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["She's looking to expand her\nclientele, no doubt.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['After all, no one can resist\nLady Herminia\'s "product."', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['My servants have prepared a feast\nof the finest delicacies in the realm.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['You are familiar with\nmy product, yes?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["One whiff and you'll be transported\nto a world of sheer bliss.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['This world is cruel and unforgiving.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Why waste your time struggling\nthrough a dreary existence?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['And I promise that all your\ndreams will be beautiful...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Do feel free to indulge some more.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['But watch out.\nYou may never want to return...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Envelop yourselves in rapture and\nbliss, my dear guests!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['He used to sell his product around here\nuntil Lady Herminia took over.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["...He can't be too happy about\nthe current situation.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Lord Taviani, I presume?\nI've heard so much about you...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['And you, Lady Herminia, are\neven lovelier than the tales say...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I can scarce imagine what beauty\nlies beneath that mask...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Forgive me for concealing myself so.\nMy line of work means I have many foes...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Indeed. Great riches invite great\nenemies...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...And your riches are the greatest\nin the realm.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['In truth, I have found myself a\ntroublesome foe as well.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['For many years, my house held\nsway in these lands.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...Until a greedy witch stole from\nus what was rightfully ours.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You'd be wise to burn your neighbor's\nhouse before your own bursts into flame.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Sage advice, indeed.\nI thank you, my lady.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Your sense of humor is most impressive.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['But has the tension in the air\nparched your throat?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Mayhap milord would enjoy\na glass of my finest wine?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['As a toast to our newfound friendship...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...Forgive me, my lady.\nSpirits have never agreed with me.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Is there no one here who will drink\nthis wine in my stead!?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Come forth, now! We cannot disrespect\nthe lady of the house!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['G-get back here!\nHave you lost your wits!?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['It would be my honor to partake\nof this fine vintage, my lady.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I cannot resist a good wine—especially\none with such a...dangerous aroma.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['An excellent vintage, I must say.\nGrapes from the Wold region, no doubt?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You've got nerve, my boy!\nI like that!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You're a fascinating young man,\naren't you?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["If you'll forgive us, Lord Taviani...\nWe should be on our way.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['You know how Lady Herminia\nmakes her "product," right?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Not quite... How <i>does</> she make\nsuch a large quantity at this quality?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You know what you'll find behind\nthis mansion?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Fields stretching out for\nleagues and leagues...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["And they say she's got a veritable\nlegion of slaves working them...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["We've harvested 4,600 gallons worth\nthis month, my lady.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["That's 100 fewer gallons than last\nmonth. Or am I mistaken?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['N-no, my lady. Some of us\nhave fallen sick, you see...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["W-we're working as hard as we can,\nmy lady, but...we're at our limit.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Maybe you should work harder\ninstead of making pathetic excuses!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['This dress was made from the finest\nsilk of the Merino worm...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Do you know how many of you I could\nbuy for the price of this dress?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Your pathetic groveling won't\nmake me any money!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Why? <i>Why</> do these dirty slaves\nbleed the same color as I!?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['This time, bleed white.\nBleed <i>white</>, I say!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I cannot take this...\nI cannot take this anymore!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Can't you maggots do <i>anything</> right!?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Slaves who disobey their mistress\nare worth less than nothing...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Now, who will receive their\npunishment next?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Yes... Scatter like the insects you are.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Few understand...that money is not\nenough to rule over people.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['There is one more thing that is\noh-so-important.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Have you gone mad?\nRemember where we are, Tiziano.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["We did what we needed to do.\nNow let's get out of here.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Huh? Didn't you get say we were\ngetting out of here?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Seems more passion burns inside\nyou than you let on, eh?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Heh! Well, wherever the boss goes,\nI go!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Huh? You came all this way, and\nyou're going to chicken out now!?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Seriously, though...\nYou're coming with us, right?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['More than happy to slaughter innocents\nfor the right price, are you?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I am in the employ of Lady Herminia.\nI was simply following orders.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Yeah, right. You're just a rabid dog\nslavering for coin.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...If you value your lives,\nbegone from this place.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["...And we're not children.\nMy name is Bargello.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Give it up, Boss. This bastard\nwon't be remembering anything.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You're not even worth\nmentioning to Lady Herminia.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I doubt she'd notice\na few more corpses anyway...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['We did it!\nServes the bastard right!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Why does the blood of the poor\nline the pockets of the rich!?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Mark my words...\nWe're going to take everything from her...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...And make it a real place to live again.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'm afraid our party must draw to a close.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Do take care on your way home, yes?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['And should you ever desire more of\nmy "product"...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...You need only say the word.\nHeh heh heh...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Twas a fabulous banquet, my lady.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['You really helped us out back there.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['We took a bit of a detour,\nbut we should be getting back.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['This path should lead us straight\ninto town.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Let's meet up again in front of\nTaviani's place.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Lady Herminia's too powerful.\nThere's no way we can fight her head on.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["So we'll use what we can...\nand who we can.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["We'll play the role of the dog until\nwe get close enough to bite her.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Things might get a little messy\nfrom here on out.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I was born and raised in this town.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I won't stand to see it sucked dry\nby that greedy demoness...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I think you'll find us more than useful...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...I like you, boy.\nYou have yourself a deal.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["If you don't mind, I'll be putting\nyou right to work.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Lady Herminia.\nYour agenda for today...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['First on the schedule is negotiations\nwith Master Otto of the Consortium...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['After that, lunch with representatives\nfrom Houses Beckel and Mazrone.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...Lady Herminia.\nOne more thing worries me.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Regarding your dealings in\nthe Frostlands...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Word has it that Lord Taviani is\nattempting to interfere...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['There is no cause for concern.\nI have already seen to the matter.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['There is nothing my wealth cannot buy.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['What do you think Taviani wants?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Yeah, this is the first time he's\ncalled for us directly.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Maybe he wants us to entertain\none of his mistresses?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["There's no faster way to burn a hole\nin your coin purse.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['The more you spend on them,\nthe more they love you.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['If you want a good mistress,\nyou gotta pay for the privilege.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Hah! So you're too noble for this.\nIs that it, Boss?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["It's like he's saying he's not\ninterested in paying for pleasure.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["...I'm <i>not</> interested in\npaying for pleasure.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Anyway, I'll bet you the job's\nnot nearly so innocent.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Taviani must have had a reason\nfor keeping it secret...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["...Bargello.\nYou've done good work for us.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Why, ever since you've joined up,\nour fortunes are better than ever.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Yes, I saw something in you\nfrom the start.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['How would you like to take on\nyour biggest task yet?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Good. Northwest of the town of\nEmberglow lies an underground ruin.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["It houses a massive stock of powder.\nIt's also where a deal will go down.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...They say Lady Herminia herself\nis going to show.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Kill her, burn her...turn her to ashes.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You're to make for Emberglow\nat once.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['My right hand will be waiting\nfor you there.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["We couldn't have asked\nfor anything more.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["I don't recall saying it was free.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I...suppose you're right.\nHow much do I owe you?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Ten thousand leaves, if you please.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Ten thousand? In my country, that's...\nHmm...one leaf is...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['How like you easterners.\nYou never know the true value of things.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I gave you a taste of heaven you'd\nnever be able to have back home.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Ten thousand leaves is a bargain.\nYou can brag to all your friends\nback home of your worldly palate.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['But you Ors...terrans have very plain tastes.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["What was that!? I won't allow an\neastern barbarian to mock me like that!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Pay up, and fast!\nI don't run a charity!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["But you don't mind swindling girls, is that right?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Has this man disrespected you!?\nI will not allow it!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Lord Eltrix! This scoundrel was about\nto flee without paying for their meal!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I have no objection to paying\nyou for what I received, but...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Ten thousand leaves for a single dish\nis outrageous, even if the gods\nthemselves prepared it.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Is this how trade is done in Ors...terra?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['But this is a common dish, to be\nfound anywhere in Grandport.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Of course, an outsider would have no idea.\nA fact that you took advantage of.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You sully Grandport's name with\nthese tricks!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I...I'm terribly sorry, my lord!\nI...I can forgive the debt.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I apologize for the first impression of my city.\nAs lord, I failed to govern my subjects properly.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Still, thank you for everything.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['It is comforting to meet a lord who\ntakes responsibility for their subjects.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['And you know a thing or two of lords,\nyes? You carry yourself well.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['We would foster warm relations with the east.\nPlease, enjoy the market at your leisure.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["My lady, we mustn't forget why we're here.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Oh, but that looks quite delicious.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["A Journey's Reason: Young Wayfarer and Shelby", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Allow me to thank you once again,\nMiss Shelby.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...I very well may have never recovered\nfrom my sickness. I might have died.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["There's no need...\nI'm simply a traveling apothecary.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Wheresoever people suffer from sickness,\nI shall go to heal them.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['But...as soon as you recovered, you left\nthe city with nary a word or farewell.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['Please, if you will...\nCan you tell me why?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["It's...it's nothing too dire.\nBut, since you asked...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I didn't want to be bound to that city, I guess.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Well, maybe it's the influence of the church,\nbut...it's full of old people set in their ways.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["The young are expected to shut up\nand do as they're told.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I see.\nYou do look to be in higher spirits.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I am. I find this place agrees with me.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['During those days, there was an\nolder man who followed me around.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I've heard that's not an uncommon\nthing with you.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Please, don't remind me...\nIt makes me sad.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['But one day, just like that,\nhe started keeping his distance.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I heard that you and him got into\na fight.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Is it true? Did you tell him to stop\nfollowing me?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Huh? I, well...\nTo be honest, I don't remember.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["And that's why you couldn't stay in\nFlamesgrace.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['So you came here.\nDo I have the truth of it?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I just didn't want to be tied down to that place.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Nothing more than that,\nand nothing less.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Is that so?\nStill, allow me to thank you.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['For inspiring me. When you set forth\nto make a new life in a new place...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...It gave me the courage to do the same.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['And now my journey has just begun too.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["So let's step into the future with\nsmiles on our faces!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Their Dreams: Nephti, Evelyn, and Saria', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['This city leaves me speechless, Nephti.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Hehe, it really is a splendid city,\neven if its residents are a bit strange.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['H-hey, I prefer to call them unique.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['One day I want to set down roots here.\nWith a handsome husband, of course...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['That sounds wonderful! To live with the one\nyou love in your dream home! How romantic.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...Oh really? I always imagined\nhaving a house all to myself.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["But doesn't living together with your\nbeloved sound like so much more fun?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Hehe, you'll understand when you're\nolder, Nephti.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['My dream house will have huge\nwindows in the ceiling.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'll hold hands with my beloved and we'll\ngaze out at the stars as we fall asleep.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You'll hold hands while you sleep?\nOh...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I think that would make me too\nexcited to sleep!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Oh no... If I can't sleep, then what\nwill happen to my dream of becoming\nthe most famous dancer in the realm...?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["But if you have windows in the ceiling, who's\nto say they won't come crashing down...?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['And the sun will be terrible in summer...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Nephti, we're talking about our dreams.\nWe're not trying to solve every little issue...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I want to grow ivy on the walls.\nMy house will be the envy of my neighbors.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['What a romantic notion! Green ivy tangled\nup the wall, from floor to ceiling.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Just like...when I hold hands with my beloved,\nand our fingers intertwine at last...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Evelyn? ...Evelyn?\nHey, come back to us now.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["But vines will damage the walls,\nto say nothing of the bugs they'll attract...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...Anyways, I was just dreaming out loud, too.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["So...what's your dream house like, Nephti?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I want a home that puts my heart at ease\nevery time I walk through the front door.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Something that's easier said than done.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You need just the right amount of light,\nand a temperature that's not too hot or cold.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['The size of the room is probably another\nimportant element to consider.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Then there's the color of the walls, their\ntexture, and the smell... It has to be perfect.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Oh, peace and quiet will tie\neverything together!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["...Ah hah! I think I've just had an idea:\nwindows that dampen incoming sounds!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I must gather materials for a test window\nat once! Sorry, but inspiration calls!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Nephti has made her mark on this city\nthrough so many wonderful buildings.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['She builds homes and whole cities\nthat come straight from the heart.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You can scour every corner of this continent\nand you'll never find another girl like her.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["She's the strangest one in this whole city?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Yes, and I wouldn't change her for the world.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Introduction to Ruin Restoration: Kota and Levan', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...Hmm. Cracks all along the outer walls.\nIt appears we have a new project.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['5 years ago, in the Woodlands region, the
restoration of an observatory thought to
be of Gaschian origin was completed.<ff/>All who beheld it were left speechless in
wonderment.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['Their amazement stemmed not from
the beauty of the edifice, but from its
resemblance to observatories of the time,<ff/>suggesting that Gaschian astronomy was far
more advanced than previously thought.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['However, subsequent investigations
revealed a fault in methodology:<ff/>the architect who worked the project
had remade the structure based on
contemporary designs.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['When we restore, we must preserve.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['Among that jumble of words,\nI gathered what you wanted to say.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Why don't I let you guide the restoration?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['Peerless Preferences: Glayne and Sofia', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['J-just say that to begin with, then.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["But there was something I heard back then,\na tale that has continued to ensnare my\nmind, that I've never been able to give up on.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['They were eight people of incredible strength\nwho survived and thrived across countless\nblood-soaked battlefields.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['They have since hid themselves from the\npublic eye, and live out their lives as average\ntownsfolk.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["For those who seek to grow to the greatest\nheights of their skill and strength, it's a story\none cannot avoid.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I think that you all might be able to confirm\nthe truth of it, though.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['To defeat them in combat would be to\nsecure your place in history as the strongest\nin all the land.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['So how about it? Fancy testing your might?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I know the whereabouts of four of the\nveteran heroes.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['One warrior resides in each of\nthese places.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["I can't believe you really beat them.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["You're even stronger than the rumors say.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['But remember, there are still\nfour veteran heroes out there\nin the world.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['In truth, I actually knew where they were, too.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Cragspear, Shepherds Rock, Clearbrook,\nand Sunshade.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You'll find the remaining warriors in\nthose locations.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["However, they act as normal citizens in their\neveryday lives, and don't generally make\nmuch show of their great strength.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["As such, you'll probably need to gain the\npeople's trust before you can make headway\non challenging the veteran heroes.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'd imagine enough that you're able to\ntake on Expert Hunts ought to do it.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I believe in you and your friends. I'll be\neagerly awaiting news of your success.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['It is you of <clan_name> who are\nthe truly fearsome ones!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["...Indeed.\n'Tis a bitter truth, but truth nevertheless.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['You approach an impasse many before you\nhave faced, wherein you must learn to\naccept the limitations of will alone...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['But there are two paths forward.\nOne of power and one of wealth.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Wealth is a means to move men to act.\nTo reshape the world. To save it.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['The power of the church, too,\ncould be used to change\nthe world for the better.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['And yet, to possess both is too much\nfor any one person to handle.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Two paths...\nbut only one may you choose to walk.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Were another to proclaim it thus,\nI might be tempted to doubt.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['But not you, Father Marlowe...\nYou who once called pontiff.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Recognized me, did you?\nHeh heh... Though it was bound\nto happen sooner or later.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Your clarity of virtue and\npurpose is why I speak to\nyou of paths and choices.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Good Millard...\nI pray you accept this gift.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Wh-what!?\nThis must be a small fortune!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['A humble offering from\nthe people of our town.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Not only did you listen to their woes,\nbut you also went to great lengths\nto gather herbs for Sam's wife.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['And so they wished to aid you in kind.\nOr, at least in the only way they knew how.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['All that I have done, I did so\nwithout expectation of payment...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Be that as it may, wealth is a means\nto save many. You cannot deny this.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["On the other hand, were you to\npursue the power of station instead,\nyou couldn't possibly accept this gift.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['For to receive payment for services rendered\nwould be a gross violation of your vows and\nsee you expelled from the church.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['So, two paths lie before you.\nWhich will it be?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Pray allow me to think\non this dilemma a moment.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Good, good! A decision made in\nhaste often leads to regret.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['But make no mistake, Millard;\nyour choice will shape your\nfuture for years to come.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Wealth and power... Either one\ncould be used to great effect\nin the salvation of many.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Either one would enable\nme to help so, so many more...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...Forgive me.\nI did not mean to withdraw\ninto my own thoughts.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I have been granted a reprieve,\nand so I would take my time to\nconsider my next course of action.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I must apologize. I've been racking\nmy brain, trying to reach a decision...\nbut the answer eludes me.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I've learned so much from the\nmany people I've met in this town...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Good folk who I sought only to serve,\nand from whom I wanted nothing.\nCertainly not wealth nor power.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['As I was saved by the church in my youth,\nso, too, did I seek to save others...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['And indeed were I to pursue\none of these levers of influence...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I could surpass my humble ambition.\nI could do great things for the good\nof the many.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['We want to thank you\nfor your tremendous kindness.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'd forgotten how wonderful it felt to\nstand on my own two feet...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["It's like a dream come true, so thank you.\nFrom the bottom of my heart.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Um... Is there anything\nwe can do for you...?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I saw you earlier.\nYou look worried about something...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["If you're in trouble, let us help!\nLike you helped us!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Father Marlowe and the mayor understood.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['As the people understood in their own way\nwhen they came together to gather wyrmwood!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I go to meet Father Marlowe.\nWill you come with me, Traveler?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["We'll speak again later!\nAnd thank you!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['You gave me my answer.\nShowed me the path I must walk.\nAnd that will be my salvation.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Ah, Millard.\nBy the look in your eyes, I take it\nyou have reached a decision?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I have.\nThe truth has been laid bare before me.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Has it now?\nThen I pray you share it with me now.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["To attain power and influence within the confines\nof a system limits one's ability to exercise it.\nThere will still be those I cannot save.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['However, wealth, too, is\na tool with constraints.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['In resolving a problem with\nmoney alone, one neglects to\naddress the underlying cause...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Oho. Another astute observation.\nTherefore...?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Do you now?\nYet again you surprise me.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Forsaking wealth and power, then,\nwhat path is left for you to walk?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['A good question,\nand one the townspeople\nhave answered for me.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["The heart which bleeds for one's brother,\nthat drives one to altruistic acts.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I benefitted from the charity of the church\nwhen I was but a child, and was duly inspired\nto become a cleric when I came of age.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['And this very day that story came full circle\nwhen I saw the spirit of charity kindled in the\neyes of a young boy.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['He was not alone.\nWhen I went to find the herbs,\nthe people came to help search.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['And in spite of their personal struggles,\nthey offered up a portion of their savings\nas thanks to an itinerant cleric...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['That is the only true path.\nTo share and share alike.\nTo save and be saved.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['If all the peoples of Orsterra could but\nembrace this guiding principle, happiness\nand fulfillment could be within our reach...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['So I will carry on in my\ntravels and preach the\nwisdom of altruism.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...Then you will eschew the paths of the king\nand the kingmaker? Seek not to change the\nworld, but to change one man at a time?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Yes. Some might call it less\nambitious, but I think it more,\nfor I seek a lasting salvation.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Well said, my boy, well said\nindeed! Rare is such wisdom\nexpressed so eloquently!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I knew I had the right of you.\nYou will forgive an old man\nhis audacity, I pray.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Your Holiness—No, Father, there is naught\nto forgive. 'Twas a necessary test,\nand I pray I answered well.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Well enough. There's none\nbetter than that which\ncomes from the heart.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['So. What now for the itinerant\ncleric Millard? Will you take to\nthe road again straightways?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Yes. There are many yet in need\nof succor, and I would preach\nunto them the way of compassion.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Very good! And if ever you are in need of my\ncounsel, pray come find me. I am not without\nmy influence, even as I enjoy obscurity!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Likewise, I may one day seek you\nout of my own accord.\nI pray I can rely upon you then.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Indeed you may!\nFor we are all deserving\nof aid and comfort.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['And with that, it is my\nhope that you will allow me to\naccompany you, fellow traveler.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['The world wants for fellowship,\nand together we will make a difference!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["E-excuse me!\nYou wouldn't happen to belong to\n<clan_name>, would you?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Aha! Word of your accomplishments\nhas spread far and wide.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I know this is sudden,\nbut I've a favor to ask.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I was bringing back a consignment of\nprecious gems from the Highlands\nwhen I was waylaid by the Serpentes.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["They're a gang of notorious\ncutthroats who've robbed and killed\nmore merchants than I can count.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Though I managed to escape with\nmy life, they took the gems and\neverything else I had of value...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["But I'll not belabor the\npoint any further.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Will you help me track down\nthe Serpentes and reclaim\nmy belongings?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Without those gems I'll be ruined!\nI may as well go and hang myself\nfrom the nearest tree.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'll do it, I will!\nYou don't want to see that, do you!?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'll go and have a word with\nmy lender. I shall return shortly!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Well isn't that an intriguing tale...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Apologies.\nDidn't mean to startle you so.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Name's Viola.\nScoundrel by trade, you might say.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Well isn't that an intriguing tale...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Apologies.\nDidn't mean to startle you so.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Seems you're keen to take back\nthe stolen goods from these\nso-called Serpentes.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Mind if tag along for a spot of fun?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'm quite familiar with their\nwicked ways, and could be\nof great help, I assure you.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Let's make for the Eastern\nSunshade Sands. When the\ntime comes, just follow my lead.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Heh heh... A familiar fat sheep's\nstrayed his flock yet again...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Funny kind of luck you've got,\ncrossing paths with the Serpentes yet again.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Go on and give over your possessions,\nquick as you like. Fast enough and you\nmight just earn yourself a painless death.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["That one's a killer!\nLet's get out of here!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Give the merchant\nback what you stole.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Of course! I'll do whatever you say,\njust please! Spare my life!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Mind taking a look?\nI'll keep an eye on our man here.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['A painless death, or the less pleasant sort.\nWhich will it be?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['But I gave you what you wanted!\nWhat about mercy!?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'll forgive you for the robbery,\nbut don't think you can make\namends for what you did to me...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I swore to reclaim everything\nyou took from me, with interest...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Good. Let's go and find that merchant.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["...They're all here.\nEach and every one of my gems!\nAt last I can repay my debt!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['It was a terrible risk that\nnearly cost me my fortune...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...But the gamble paid off, gods be praised!\nAnd you, too! Thank you!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I suppose I ought to thank\nyou as well, Traveler.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Our little adventure's brought\nme one step closer to my goal.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['We ought to do this again, you and I.\nSomething tells me you have a knack for\ngetting into my kind of trouble.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Please, have some! It's a specialty.\nNot sold anywhere but here.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You've more than earned it,\nafter getting back those gems for me.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['You know the Serpentes, they\nused to have a reputation as\nnoble thieves, believe it or not.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Made a point of targeting the corrupt and\nvillainous. Merchants, nobles—no matter\nhow powerful or influential, none were safe.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Folks likened them to Emberglow's\nWhite Wolves. Said they were\nworthy successors...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Least they did back in the beginning...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Lately, they've been targeting\ngood folk who've had little to\nanswer for and a lot to lose.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Seems the White Wolves were one\nof a kind after all. No such thing as\nan honorable rogue, is there...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...The Serpentes you dispatched\nwere no more than common thugs.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["But so long as they remain to\nterrorize us, Sunshade's markets\nwill never prosper.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['So I implore you, my friend, hunt\ndown the Serpentes to the last villain!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['And if you manage to carry out\nthis considerable task...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["...I've no doubt that the traders\nof Sunshade would see that you\nare well rewarded for the trouble.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Thank you. I will pray for your success,\nmy friend, and deliver word of\nyour good intention to the others!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['They must use only the finest grapes.\nLittle wonder the wine tastes so sweet.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["If you're looking for the Serpentes' hideaway,\nyou'll find it in the Finesand Ruins.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Deprive them of their home\nand they'll be all but finished.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'll show you the way...\nafter I finish my drink.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Gah! How much longer\ndo we have to wait!?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'm itching for another score.\nJust let us head out into the\ndesert for a spell, that's all I ask!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Not without orders.\nChief said wait, so we wait.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Rumor has it that\n<clan_name>'s on our trail.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["One wrong step and we'll all\nbe found out. The hideaway,\nthe chief—everything...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I already know you better than\nyou know yourselves... Not to mention\nthis place and its many entrances.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Heh heh...\nI'm flattered you still remember.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Because I relive every agonizing\nmoment of my disgrace,\nday after day after day...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["And now it's your turn.\nEverything you took,\nI'll take back—with interest.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Right, then.\nThere must be something\nwe can use to tie him up.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Idiot.\nDid you really think it'd be that easy?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["It's almost impressive how\nempty this place is.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["They must've moved the\ncache before we arrived.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Wouldn't surprise me if the\nchief was sitting on it himself.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["He's nowhere near here,\nof course. No, he's the type to\nsend orders from afar...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Ah. Curious how I know entirely\ntoo much about these bandits?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Thought you'd've guessed it\nby now. I was once one of 'em.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Until I was betrayed and left for dead...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["But that's a tale for another time.\nThe merchant will want to hear of\nour progress.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Really!?\nYou struck down the Serpentes\nin their hideaway?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["That's incredible!\nFinally we can go about our\nbusiness without fear!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Their chief is still out there.\nI'd not let your guard down just yet.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Very well!\nI'll advise the others to do the same!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Cards on the table, then.\nRevenge is my game, and I've shamelessly\nused <clan_name> to play it.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["But you've no need to be cross.\nI've been a valuable ally to you\nthus far, haven't I?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["There's no reason we can't\nstill fight side by side, be it for\ncauses great or small.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Heh, in any case...\nyou will need to excuse me.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I've met with a most esteemed\nnobleman who wished to meet\nwith you in person.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["He's pledged a considerable\ninvestment to the complete and\nutter destruction of the Serpentes.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Greetings and well met.\nI am Strahd.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['When I heard that you and yours single-\nhandedly drove the villains from their desert\nhovel, I knew I had to take your measure.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Let us pray that your efforts to\nsnuff out the few stragglers\nremaining are swift and successful.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Bravo, Strahd, bravo.\nIn another life, you might've enjoyed\nsome notoriety as a middling actor.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Oh, I'm but a humble associate of\n<clan_name>, committed to hunting\ndown every last one of the Serpentes.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Their chief in particular.\nYou wouldn't happen to know\nwhere I could find him?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Me? Why in the world would I\nknow a thing like that?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Indeed. A pity.\nWe can't rightly kill a viper\nin hiding, now can we?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Always skulking about in shadow,\nsending his underlings to do his dirty\nwork. Cowardice has shielded him well.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['But should you ever find yourself in his\ncompany—unlikely though it may\nbe—please convey to him this message...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['"Everything you took,\nI\'ll take back—with interest."', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['If you would excuse us.\nThe hunt awaits.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Let's take the backstreets.\nI've an inkling we'll learn what\nwe need to know soon enough.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Ah, er...\nPerhaps it would have been\nbetter had I not introduced you?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Nay, all is well. Or shall be\nin due course. Come—we\nhave business to discuss.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Any moment now we should\nhave our next lead on the Serpentes...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['You are far too considerate,\nretiring to a place free from prying eyes.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Murder should be a private affair...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Wait!\nPerhaps we can reach an\nalternative arrangement...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Every time, I swear. Every time you lot\ntry to weasel your way out of it. Makes\nme sick to see how far you've fallen.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['It all went so horribly\nwrong after you left—', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I was betrayed!\nDon't get into the habit of\npicking the wrong words now.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Then let me choose the right ones.\nI shall be glad to call you chief again!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['So you can stick another knife\nin my back? Someone already\ntried that the other day.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Aye, it's as he says.\nI used to be chief of the Serpentes.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Back then, we only went after blue bloods\nwith black hearts. No sport in preying on\nthe powerless innocents, you know?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Heh... Though that preference led\nsome to think it was a kind of morality.\nNoble thieves and all that rot.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Good sport, aye, but hard work.\nHim and his grew tired of the hassle.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['So they killed me and took\neverything I had built.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Aye, for the spirit of vengeance\nwill keep my corpse moving long\nenough to settle the score.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Cast our lot in with Strahd, or die.\nThat was the ultimatum.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['You heard right. That man you met in\nthe tavern is the current chief of the Serpentes.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Used our wealth to buy his way into polite society,\nand has ordered his underlings about from the\nperfumed comfort of his estate ever since.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['But all good things must come to an end.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Now listen carefully and you just\nmight live to see tomorrow.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Good.\nBecause I've a mind to put you to work.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['This tale deserves a finish\nbefitting honorable thieves.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Strahd hosts one every month.\nInvites all the highborn families and\nentertains them at great expense.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Heh, a lovely gesture.\nAnd a perfect venue to enact my revenge.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I've done as asked!\nG-given you invaluable information!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You said you'd set me free.\nYou swore!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I say, are these imperial\ngoldfish from Goldshore?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Indeed they are. Packed tightly in\nice soulstones so that they might be\ndelivered fresh to your lips.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['And this wine, magnificent!\nA Valore white, if I am not mistaken?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['A favorite of the Witch herself.\nRarely did she hold a feast without\nthis vintage to grace her table.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['My friends, I bid you cast aside your worries\nand think not of the world that lies beyond\nmy door. For tonight, we dine in heaven!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Even with spoils of the Serpentes,\nyou couldn't afford good taste, I see.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Oh please.\nHe learned it from you.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Right, then.\nI believe you had a few words\nto speak on Strahd here's behalf?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['The man you all know as Lord Strahd\nis none other than the leader of the\nnotorious bandits, the Serpentes!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Hah...hahahahaha!\nA poor—nay, ridiculous jest!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['As if anyone here would deign\nto entertain the fantasies of you lot!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["There's a passage beneath\nthat table—hidden stairs!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["It leads to the vault where he's\nkeeping everything we stole!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["If you don't believe me, go\nand see for yourselves! It's all\nthe proof you need that he's—", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["It's mine! It's all mine!\nI won't let you take it from me! Never!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["No...no! You don't understand!\nIt's not what you think!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Ahahaha!\nThe viper's shown his true colors at last.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Drape him in the finest silks and shower\nhim in jewels, but beneath it all, the brute\nwith a penchant for violence remains!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["The watch is on the way.\nThink you can maintain the charade\nwhen they've seen your bloodied hands?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["This...this isn't over!\nI'm not ruined yet!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'll clean it up—start over fresh!\nOnce I've finished killing you all!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["That's the spirit. Fight tooth and nail.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Everything you took from me,\nI'll take from you—with interest!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I was waiting. Waiting for you\nto grow fat on the spoils.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["There's no sport in robbing\nthe weak, after all...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Never could keep pace with you...\nThen and now...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Come, we'd best be\noff before the watch arrives.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['A toast. To the fall of the Serpentes.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Heh, what else?\nI travel with <clan_name>\nin search of the next adventure.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["So long as I stick with you,\nI'm sure to get my fill of\nexcitement and drama.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You'll want help with what comes your\nway, and I'll be happy to offer mine.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["And we'll make a profit in the doing...\nWhat do you say?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Hello there! My name's Theo.\nTraveling apothecary by trade.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I could really use a helping\nhand, and, well, all I ask is\nthat you hear me out.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Have I ever told you about my grandmother?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Her name's Pollonia.\nShe's an apothecary, like me.\nQuite famous in the Flatlands, truth be told...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["...And that's the problem. Some\nfolks are attempting to use her good\nname to peddle their counterfeit stock.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["So if you're willing, Traveler,\nI'd like your assistance in gathering\nup all the fake medicine in circulation.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["And I can tell you right\naway if it's fake or not.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Aye, I did indeed purchase\nsome of Pollonia's curatives...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Ah, thought so.\nThese are counterfeit.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['The traveling apothecary who sold them to\nme. It was all very official. He even kept them\nin a box emblazoned with her flowery crest.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'm afraid our crest is quite different.\nWhatever his claims, he's got no ties to us.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["I have plenty of curatives to spare.\nIf you like, I'd be happy to exchange\nsome for yours.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Wait...\nWhat proof do you have that\nyou're who you say you are?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Well, we'll be in town for a while,\ntracking down fake medicine.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['If yours seems off or makes you ill,\nthen come and find me. You can\nstill make good on my offer then.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Pollonia's curatives? Please.\nNot worth a tenth of the\nprice if you ask me!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['But look! This wound on my\narm that a beastie gave me\nis as awful as ever!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You've been had, friend. That wasn't\nPollonia's medicine. Here, this bears\nher true seal, as you can see.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['By all means, apply it to\nyour wound. The results\nshould speak for themselves.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Huh... Well I'll be! The pain's gone\nand melted away, just like that!\nWho'd you say you were again?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Theo, grandson of Pollonia herself.\nI don't suppose you know of anyone else\nwho's purchased these counterfeit curatives?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["Why yes, I bought some\nof Pollonia's curatives.\nWhy do you ask?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Someone's been selling counterfeit\nmedicine, I'm afraid. We're trying to\ntrack down as much of it as we can.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I see!\nWhile you're at it,\nmind taking a look at this?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Something for fatigue and malaise,\nthe fellow said. Sold it to me for a discount.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Interesting. More false promises,\nI expect. I'll be sure to look into\nit as well.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Take these curatives with my thanks.\nI promise they won't disappoint.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Much obliged, and good day to you.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Phew. That's a fair amount of fake\nmedicine we've managed to track down.\nEnough for now, I think.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["This charlatan is not only harming my\ngrandmother's reputation, but putting\ninnocent lives at risk just to turn a profit...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'll see if I can't find out more\nabout him. Someone's got to\nknow something.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['Are you him?\nThe young grandson of\nthe apothecary Pollonia?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["But I don't think it's done\none bit of good. I thought you\nmight be able to tell me why.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['Our local apothecary, of course.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["He said it was sure to do\nthe trick, seeing as it was\nPollonia's own recipe.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Did you hear that?\nThis apothecary has some\nexplaining to do...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Begging your pardon, sir,\nbut I hear you've got some of\nPollonia's medicine on offer?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['I was wondering if you could tell me\nhow you procured your stock of pills.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["I'd like very much to see it,\nif that's all right.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["That would explain it.\nThis recipe is completely\ndifferent from my grandmother's.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['But the apothecary who sold\nit to me was an apprentice\nof Pollonia herself!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['As evidenced by this box\nemblazoned with her\nfamily crest, I wager.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Indeed,\nI remember the flower petal motif well.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["That man has been abusing my grandmother's\ngood name to peddle fake medicine\nand now this sorry excuse for a recipe.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Then...\nI-I've been deceiving my\ncustomers this whole time?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Afraid so.\nYou didn't suspect a thing?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['Please accept my most humble apologies...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Now, now. There's no use getting\ndown on yourself. If you've time\nfor that, you've time to make amends.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["Do you have records who bought\nthe bad pills? You'll need to give them\nthe proper stuff, and quickly.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['Ah, I should go and see that\nold woman and thank her for the lead.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["But how to find where this criminal\nis hiding. That's the question...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Theo's the man to go to for\nPollonia's medicine, they say.\nPlease, I'm begging you!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["...I'm afraid not. Beyond that,\nI'm at a loss for where to\nbegin our search...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['And judging by the flowery crest\non that box, this is <i>your</> scheme.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Why? Why go through all this trouble?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["The man I'm trying to find is Faust.\nImpresario of the Dawnsong Players.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["It's really, really important that I\nspeak with him as quickly as possible.\nSo please, help me find him!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Um, excuse me, but...\nYou wouldn't happen to be Faust of the\nDawnsong Players? The impresario?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...Why are you looking at me like that?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["Then, you'll accept me into the troupe...?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['Another member of the troupe has\ngone missing, sir. I was wondering if\nyou might know anything about it...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['Anyway!\nThey say the Dawnsong Players\nare the greatest troupe in all Orsterra.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'm sure the members can teach me all\nsorts of essential skills. So even if the\ntraining is tough, I've got to stick it out!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["There you are, Lynette.\nI've got a small job for you,\nif you're up for it.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['We need to drum up interest in our\nnext performance. Do you think you\ncould dance for the people in town?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['Excellent.\nThen I will leave you to it.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I suppose we'd best get started, then!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['The Dawnsong Players wish to offer\nto you, our beloved fans, a preview\nof our upcoming performance.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["Curious...\nI could swear I've seen\nyour dancing before...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['Ah, I see!\nThe daughter of that legend, are you?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["Well!\nI've got to practice even harder, then!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'd say this was a successful promotion.\nWe should go and report back to Joel.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["We're back! I think it went quite well.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["You're bleeding our people dry,\nyet leaving the more privileged\nmerchants unscathed.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Living in a powerful and prosperous\nfiefdom should warrant nothing\nbut devotion from our lesser man.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['And those who have the gall to step\nout of line may just lose their lives...\nLike Jim.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['You would have a poor man murdered\njust to protect your own repute!?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['That academy clearly\ntaught you nothing, boy.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['The poor exist to serve the wealthy.\nThat is simply the rule of this world!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Your spoiled, selfish actions\nwill be our ruin!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['At least I am not betraying\nmy own flesh and blood.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Fraternize with the dogs and you\ndeserve to die like one of them!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["His actions were but one\nsource of the people's suffering.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['He was concerned solely with\nlining his own pockets and spared\nnot a thought for the people...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Yet I am not innocent in this.\nIf only I had listened,\nhe would still be alive...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['Had I not forsaken my own lands,\nI could have saved Jim and my\npeople from their suffering...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['I was wondering...if you would\ncome visit him with me.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I...would like to have closure.\nBut I don't have the strength to do it alone.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...Hello, Jim.\nI stopped by to offer my parting words.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I have assumed my place as\nthe head of House Danfole.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['I have lifted the taxes my uncle\nimposed, so your family will not\nhave that weigh on their minds.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
