['But I will continue my studies to that end,\nthat I may one day find a solution.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['My duties as lord of our lands\nthreaten to eclipse my idealistic\nambition as a scholar.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['However, this is the path that has\nbeen laid before me and I will not\nshirk my duties of land or letter.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I have much to thank you for. You\nhumbled me and saved me from\nbecoming a monster like my uncle.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['You strengthened my conviction\nto resolve these injustices that\nplagued you in life.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I shall not succumb to the\nrapaciousness of fiefdom. I shall\nnot allow another sacrifice like yours.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I admit I am still inexperienced\nas both a lord and a scholar.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I must broaden my horizons on\nboth fronts and learn more about\nthe realm to achieve my goals.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Therefore, I humbly ask to\naccompany <clan_name>\nwhen you travel around the realm.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Thank you!\nNow then, shall we be off?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["I was supposed to meet a merchant here,\nbut I'm starting to suspect they may not\nbe coming at all.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['One begins to nod off with all this waiting.\nMight you be willing to keep me company?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["This tale stretches far back into this\nregion's history, before even the first\nstone was laid in Valore's foundation...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...Thus, it was for that reason that when\nI turned to my very first adventure—', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Ah! But it seems that time has\nmade a fool of me once more.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['He all but forced the leaves into\nmy hand and made off with it.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['A man who called himself Morbidus.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["I can't tell you how sorry\nI am about all of this.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Such is how things go with a man\nlike Morbidus. Nonetheless,\nI must get the tablet back...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Morbidus, you purloining thief!\nReturn the stone tablet to me!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Come to get in my way yet again, Peredir?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["You selfish churl!\nI'll take it by force, then!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['It will be the clue that leads me\nto discover the ruins for myself!\nYou may feel free to hold your breath!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['It suggests that there is a mountain\nto the south of Gasche.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...But that is the extent of the\ninformation it provides.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['Excellent!\nLet us get right to work, then.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["<i>You're</> the one always getting in <i>my</> way!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['That blasted Morbidus...\nHe turned tail and fled alone.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["Hmm, not here either...\nBut this is the place. I'm sure of it...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['Which is why I need an impartial\nsource to help me piece together\na more accurate interpretation.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['To the matter at hand: the bookseller.\nWill you help me find him?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['Then I am satisfied.\nHave fun, my girl.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['Tis everything I could\nhave asked for and more.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Did you enjoy working as an appraiser?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['As I knew you would. You have a\ngift for history, and I have no doubt\nyou will become a peerless scholar.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['May this mark the beginning of a long\nand storied partnership between us...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['As scholar and merchant today...\nAs husband and wife tomorrow.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['If I fail the exam and am denied admittance\nto the Archaeological Society...\nFather insists that I be wed to Scott.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["He's convinced himself that I'll find true\nfulfillment in carrying on the family legacy.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["But what I don't understand is why Scott\nwould encourage my scholarly pursuits...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'm grateful for the support, but...\nI wonder about his true intentions...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Year of the Divine 1401...\nThe Kingdom of Grandport\nattempts to annex the Flatlands.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['The impact of the war in the Highlands\nextends to the Kingdom of Wold and—', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Father! Lower your voice, please!\nI am trying to study!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Foolish child! You dare to call\nthis rubbish an appraisal!?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['What cause have you to speak to me thus!?\nI was very thorough in my research!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['Do you have any idea how much\nshame you have brought upon us!?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['How can someone so easily deceived\npossibly have what it takes to be a\nrespectable scholar!?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Never mind your laughable ambitions for the\nArchaeological Society! I've humored you\nenough. You will come home this instant!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["...You're right. This is...unacceptable.\nI'll begin packing my things at once.\nPlease go on ahead.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['But clearly a vase was brought to the\nuniversity—and a fake one at that.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Something's rotten about all this.\n...Scott owes me answers.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Sorry to barge in like this,\nbut... Huh. That vase...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["History does not lie...\nThough men do, I'm afraid.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["That was your plan all along, wasn't it?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Your cut of the profits. We'll split it\nthirty-seventy. It's more than fair, I'd say.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Your good name and my business\nacumen... Together we could go\nso very, very far.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You're...you're actually serious, aren't you?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Absolutely not!\nI would never compromise my\nprinciples for such petty ends!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You make it sound so cut and dry...\nBut then again a stupid little highborn\nwouldn't know any better, would she?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['And there I had such high hopes\nfor us. Pity. Nothing for it but to\nwipe the slate clean...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['After soiling it with your blood, that is.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You're right. I am stupid. I truly\nbelieved you wanted to help me...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'm so sorry, Laura. I had no idea\nhe was such a scoundrel...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Clearly I am a rather poor judge of\ncharacter. I pray you can find it in\nyour heart to forgive me.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['I was too quick to trust, to believe.\nI wanted so very much for you\nto find fulfillment.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['To find it in a life that met my\nexpectations, I now realize...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['But no more. I will not presume to tell you how\nto conduct your affairs. If you wish to continue\nyour studies, you have my full support.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['So long as you do what makes you\nhappy, then I shall be happy for you.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Thank you, Father.\nThat means a lot to me.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["And, what's worse... Neglecting\nyour diet's going to take a toll\non your body over time.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["Not a shy one, are you?\nHaha, that's what I like to see!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['What would Grandfather do...?\nWhat would the Crimson Blade do...?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'm so sorry...\nI believe Silke is in the Finesand Ruins.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["...I understand.\nThis, too, must be the Sacred Flame's will.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Well then, I'll have to inform Flamesgrace\nthat I'm postponing my retirement.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Promise us you'll\ncome back to this village.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Yes, you. I want to ask you something.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Have you heard the tales\nof the "one-eyed wolf"?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Mainly of monsters with\nhefty bounties on them.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["...Now that I think about it,\nI haven't told you about my current target.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I\'m after a monster known\nas the "one-eyed wolf."', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['A certain noble family has placed\nquite the price on its head.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Actually, the bounty has been\noutstanding for decades now.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["In other words, no one's yet\nbrought the beast down.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Hell, hardly anyone seems\nto have even <i>seen</> it.\nIt's cunning, and cautious.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['It only makes its presence known\nwhen it strikes at its prey...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I daresay that makes it more\nfearsome than other monsters\nthat posture in displays of strength.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['They love to hunt laughing hyaena.\nThink you could help me capture one?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["We should be able to find some\nat Cragspear Pass. Let's go.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["These beasts are quick.\nWe'll have to be as well!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['This should be enough.\nThanks for your help.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'm going to head out and try\nto catch that one-eyed wolf.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'm going to be a rich man,\nthanks to you.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...You again.\nThanks for your help before.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I was able to set a trap,\nbut the beast never showed.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["But I won't give up yet.\nThere's a lot of money on the line.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Besides, I came across\nsome new information.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Seems a merchant was attacked\nby a huge wolf on the road.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Don't know if it had just a single\neye or not, but I mean to find out.\nWant to join me?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Thank you.\nThat sets my mind at ease.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Could you tell us about\nthe beast that attacked you?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I was traveling along\nSouth Cragspear Pass, heading\nout to purchase some product.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['We were attacked suddenly from behind.\nMy guards were cut down almost instantly...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...Did you see if the beast\nhad an injured right eye?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I couldn't say.\nIt all happened so fast...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["With that monster on the road,\nI daresay I won't be doing much business.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You're a hunter, aren't you?\nPerhaps you could dispatch it for me?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['There will be a reward, of course.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['If it turns out to be the\none-eyed wolf, all the better.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Let's head for\nSouth Cragspear Pass.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["But a reward is a reward.\nLet's take it down.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['That was close...\nGood thing you were here.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Let's report back to that merchant.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I took down the monster\nthat attacked you.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Thank you.\nYou've saved my business.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['A paltry sum, but\nbetter than nothing...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'm saving up so that I might properly\nrepay my mother and father...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Though, while I call them that,\nthey are not my birth parents.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['When I was a child, I was saved from\na monster by the man I now call father.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['But he sustained a grievous injury,\nand lost the use of his right leg.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['So my new mother had to work\nenough for both of them...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['So much toil and strife...\nAll because of me...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['So I want to earn enough money\nto let them live in comfort for\ntheir remaining years.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['That is why I seek such great rewards.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Aye. And that bounty shall be mine\nonce I bring down the one-eyed wolf.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['The noble who placed the bounty on the\none-eyed wolf has asked to speak with me.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Would you accompany me to the tavern?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...Actually, I have one stop to make first.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I would like to give the reward from\nthat merchant to mother and father.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I would be glad to introduce\nyou as well. What do you say?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['How wonderful for Bertrand\nto make such a fine friend...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["...Y-yes, well. Mother, Father, here.\nI've brought some more money.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'll have more next time,\njust you wait.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Oh?\nWell, don't work too hard, you hear?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["She's right, Bertrand.\nWe appreciate the money of course, but...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Father, it is my fault your\nleg is of no use to you.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Please allow me to repay\nyou the only way I can.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Sorry about all the fuss.\nI only wanted them to see\nI had a trusted compatriot.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["They have worked so hard\nfor me, when I'm not even\ntruly their flesh and blood.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["It's only right I work as hard for them.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Aye. I'll claim the\nbounty on that wolf yet.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Apologies for keeping you waiting.\nI am Bertrand, the hunter.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I am Reinfeldt, the one who placed the\nbounty on the one-eyed direwolf.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I heard how you dispatched\nthat beast on the bluffs.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I think you're just the man to\ntake down the one-eyed wolf.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...Why do you bear a grudge against it?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Grudge is far too plain a word for it!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Long ago, my son was\ntaken by that beast.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["It broke my dear wife's heart.\nShe passed away soon after from grief.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Precisely! Not just for my son's life, but\nfor mine! Everything was taken from me.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I know it cannot be brought back,\nbut I can at least settle the score...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["So I've pursued it, placed bounties on it...\nAnd I finally know where it's den is.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Hm... But why would it give\naway its position now?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Something must have happened.\nIt's been so cautious until now...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['We hunted down some hyaenas for a trap.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["And that's left the wolf with no\nprey of its own. It's had to stray\nfarther from its den for food.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Well then, it seems I\nalready owe you thanks.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Apparently it makes its den\nin the Abandoned Mines.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I must properly prepare.\nI want to make sure the beast falls.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'm ready to hunt\nthe one-eyed wolf.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Good, then let's head for\nthe Abandoned Mines.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Here we are, wolf, face-to-face at last!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I will be the one to strike you down!\nThat bounty is good as ours!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['We did it...\nNow the bounty will be ours!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Then you agree,\nthe bounty is ours.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...By the way, Bertrand.\nHow did you get that\nmark on your neck?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'm not sure to be honest.\nMy parents found me\nabout fifteen years ago.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["If my son were alive,\nI daresay he'd be about your age...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['And he had a birthmark just like yours...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I am Bertrand. A hunter.\nThat is all I am.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["If you'll excuse me,\nI have somewhere to be.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['But that means this Reinfeldt\ncould be your real father!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['What does blood\nmatter at this point...?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["It matters!\nIt's not too late, Bertrand.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['If this Reinfeldt truly is your father...\nthen you should be with him.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You've found your real father.\nThis is a joyous moment.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['And this Reinfeldt can\nprovide for you, Bertrand!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['That leg... You injured it\nsaving Bertrand, yes?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You saved my son's life.\nI must repay you.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['If your injury prevents you from\nworking, you must at least allow\nme to compensate you.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Ah, but we have the reward money\nBertrand saved up for us.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["And I wouldn't trade the time\nwe had with Bertrand for any\namount of money anyway.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I much rather feel sorry that\nwe took that time away from\nyou, Master Reinfeldt.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['....You have been raised\nwith love, Bertrand.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Knowing that gives me peace, truly.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['To have a birth parent and adopted\nparents who care for me so...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["There's no mistake...\nIt <i>must</> be through here!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Would you mind holding off on\nventuring forth from here for a moment?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Ah, but where are my manners.\nI am Miles, an apprentice Knight Ardante.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Forgive my rudeness, but I have\nimportant business up ahead.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['My instructor Rhiom has ordered\nme to pursue a bandit.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I uncovered his hideout, but he\nwas gone by the time I arrived.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["However, I've received word\nthat he has reappeared.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["That's right.\nHis hideout is just up ahead.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I've been pursuing him for a full month now.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I can't let this chance slip away.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Of course, I doubt he will come quietly.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I wouldn't want you to get drawn in,\nso could I ask you to wait here?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Well, this may indeed be my only\nchance. I should make the most of it.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Very well.\nPlease lend me your strength!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Freeze, scoundrel! You are being\napprehended by the Knights Ardante!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["But you sniffed me out. You\nknights aren't as dumb as you look.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['In truth, I am merely an apprentice.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['But capturing you will bring me\none step closer to knighthood!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["But of course, I couldn't have\ndone it without you. You must\nallow me to reward you.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['But first I must report back to\nmy instructor! Would you mind\naccompanying me to Emberglow?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Miles?\nDon't tell me you've given up already...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['No, sir, just the opposite!\nI finally apprehended that bandit!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I suppose this must\nprove how I've grown—", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Frankly, I'd be worried if you\ncouldn't catch one measly bandit.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Might I be allowed to interrogate—', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I owe you for helping me\ncapture that bandit.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['I hope to become as fine a knight as he.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['But first I must prove my\nworth to Instructor Rhiom.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Instructor Rhiom, you called for me?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['Apparently these frostferns\ngrow in Snowshard Grotto.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Instructor Rhiom, I believe that grotto is\nwell-known to be a den of war wolves...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Is that fear I hear in your voice?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["But surely you know of\nthe war wolves' ferocity!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Just one is dangerous enough,\nbut sending an apprentice such\nas I into a den of them...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I will accept refusal as your\nresignation from the Knights Ardante.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You could lose your life if you're\nnot careful. Might be smarter to\nrun if it comes down to it.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Oh, I have dreamed of becoming\na knight worthy of my father...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['But a den of war wolves would\nbe a tall order for even the\nmost seasoned knight.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Perhaps that is what it will\ntake to achieve my dream...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Frostferns can be found in\nthe Snowshard Grotto beyond\nthe West Emberglow Wilds.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I couldn't have prevailed alone...\nThank you again.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Let us deliver the\nfrostfern to Instructor Rhiom.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['What!? You mean you went\nto Snowshard Grotto!?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...You must indeed have.\nThis is frostfern, no doubt about it.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["How on earth did you\nsurvive the war wolves' den....?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Alone it would have been impossible.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["...Though, I don't recall saying it was\nokay to ask for assistance on this task.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['What if someone sustained an injury\nwhile helping the Knights Ardante?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Who would take responsibility for that?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["What's done is done. I'll take this.\nYou go and cool your head.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I suppose it's a virtue to know your limits...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Miles, I've been looking all over for you.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Instructor Rhiom asked me to come get you.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Head for the camp on the\neastern outskirts of town.\nDon't make him wait.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['You mean to come with me?\nI am heartened, but...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Very well, let us head for\nthe eastern outskirts.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...Hm?\nI thought I was to meet Instructor Rhiom here.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I made that up. This has\nnothing to do with the instructor.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Rhiom really takes a shine to\nyou, doesn't he, Miles?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["The instructor's crafty, that's why\nhe keeps you at arm's length.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['And why he gives you those impossible tasks!\nTo stop you from becoming a Knight Ardante!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['You must have caught on by now!\nStop fooling yourself!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You're an embarrassment!\nA disgrace to the knights!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Do you really not know?\nYou don't know what your father did?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['My father was a decorated knight!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Leave before you bring more\nshame to the Knights Ardante!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["If Instructor Rhiom won't chase\nyou off himself, we will!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['We...wanted to carry out\nyour will...Instructor Rhiom...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['You meant to carry out a punishment\nin my stead that I have never ordered...?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['The duty of the Knights Ardante is to\nprotect believers of the Sacred Flame.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Your sword is meant to protect!\nYour personal vendetta only sullies it!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['You are hereby confined to your quarters!\nNow get out of my sight!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Instructor Rhiom, please,\nyou don't have to apologize.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I must. It is my failure that I did not\nproperly educate those apprentices.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['But at least I can take this\nopportunity to be honest with you.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Miles, you should give up on\njoining the Knights Ardante.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["My father's dishonor would\nbecome common knowledge?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['My father, Layard, was a\ndistinguished knight.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['At the same time, he is known as\nboth a deserter...and a turncoat.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...I will explain more at another time.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...I wonder if you might spare me some time?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I need help investigating something\nabout my father, Layard.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['With a traitor for a father, the only\nway I can become a knight...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["...is to reveal the truth,\nand restore my father's name.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I do not believe my father was truly a traitor.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Will you help me discover the truth?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['First, I suppose we should ask\nthe Knights Ardante around town.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Yes. I was hoping to learn more of my\nfather's betrayal. Do you know anything?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'm afraid not. I think there's only one\nperson who would know much of anything.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Can you tell me who they would be?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["There's a knight who was in\nthe same unit as Layard.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['She would probably know something.\nShe should be on guard duty near the inn.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Apologies, but I don't know\nanything more than you do.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Do you know anything about who\nmay have witnessed something?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'm afraid the brass don't let the rank and\nfile like us in on anything of much import.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Instructor Rhiom wants to see you.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['In the West Emberglow Wilds,\nwhere you caught that bandit before.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Instructor Rhiom!\nDid you have some new orders for me?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'll do whatever you ask, to prove\nmy worth as a Knights Ardante...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["...I've been trying to steer you away\nfrom becoming a Knight Ardante.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I've been hazing you, just\nlike those apprentices.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['But no matter how dangerous or\nimpossible the task, you take it on\nearnestly...and deliver.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I had always envied your father.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Kinder than all...and braver, too.\nJust like Layard...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...If you become a knight, everyone\nwill know the truth of what happened.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Many of the Order would scorn you.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["That's why you must give up on joining...\nYour life would be nothing but hardship...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I am not so weak as to run away from\nmy lifelong dream over such a matter.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I am the son of Layard\nof the Knights Ardante.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['You have put me through many trials.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Through them I have grown stronger.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I want to become a knight\nand learn the truth...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Prepare yourself, this will be\nyour most difficult task yet.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['No matter what occurs, you\nmust hold fast to your blade!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I will become a knight and\nlearn the truth about my father.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Until then...\nI hope I can count on you.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["...You don't know what\nI'm talking about, do you?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Curses! I thought for sure you were\nthe one I'm meant to meet here.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['Out with it already!\nDo you have a request or not!?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Er, uh, yes... Well, it's just that a red fox\nis running rampant on the Valore Trail.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["A red fox, eh?\nI'll make short work of it.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...No matter what she says,\nshe still looks a bit green to my eyes.\nCould you go with her?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'm fine by myself, but...an extra set of\nhands <i>will</> make the work even shorter.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Come on, let's head for Valore Trail.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["There it is. That man wasn't kidding.\nIt really is on a rampage...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["...But this one isn't, so\nwe'll have to put it down.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["Thanks for taking care of that...\nAnd I'm sorry I doubted you.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Don't mention it. Besides, having this\none along really did make it easier.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['More importantly...a word of advice.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["That's why I'm here, to pray to the\ngods for the safety of passing ships.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'm not concerned because I'm lost,\nbut because something troubling\nhas happened...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You're not planning on leaving this\ntown just yet, are you? I'm entrusted\nwith the blessing of ships.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Praying for the safety of\nsea voyages is my job.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Many ships have been sinking in this town.\nSo many so that it's put me in a tight spot.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I've been rushing to get\nall these blessings done.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["But I've slipped up.\nI'm out of the lime needed for the rituals.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['There should be plenty of\nlime along the Rippletide Coast.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Yes, as expected.\nPlenty of lime to be found here.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["This should be enough.\nLet's head back to town.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Thanks for helping me out.\nNow I'll be able to pray for\nthe ships without issue.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['In the olden days, people used\nto sacrifice an innocent\nmaiden to calm the storm.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Awful, isn't it?\nI don't want that to happen again.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['As a cleric, I cast the blessing of\nAelfric upon ships to reassure sailors.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['In addition, I check the wind and\nweather conditions in order to advise\na safe date and route for the voyage.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Their voyage will be all the safer\nwith both the blessing\nand knowledge of the sea.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Pardon me, good cleric, I'd like to request\nanother blessing, if that's okay.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Shipmaster,\ndo you really trust such blessings?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['That goes without saying, Giacomo.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["As a merchant, you'd be in quite some\ntrouble if the cargo sank, would you not?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['By the way, do you plan to\nenter the open ocean?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Yes...but, the sailors are fearful of the storm.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["If that's the case, just leave it to me.\nI'll incite a blessing to ward off danger!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Tch, the sea can't be calmed by mere prayer.\nHow can you take this bratty kid seriously?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Look here, there's no harm in giving it a go.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Hmph, have it your way.\nI doubt the sailors will think much of it.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['In order to determine a suitable day for\ndeparture, I need to observe the harbor\nand surrounding sea from high ground.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['The view from here is really good.\nOne can easily assess the state\nof the surrounding sea.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Hmm... Cloudless, and the waves are gentle.\nNo sign of trouble for the voyage...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Could the direction of the wind bode ill?\nBut at this time of year, the wind should be...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Let's get back to the port.\nIf we don't hurry, we'll miss the\nopportune moment!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I shall bestow blessings upon this ship...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You really expect this to work?\nIf you're caught in a storm,\nyou'll have to pay the price.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["When the wind changes course, that's a\nsign my prayers have reached the gods!\nThis voyage is in safe hands.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["And if the wind doesn't change\nwe'll be in danger?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['But fear not...\nMy prayers will reach them.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Aelfric, bringer of the Sacred Flame...\nBifelgan, god of wind and trade...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['May the Sacred Flame and\nwind guide this ship and\nits sailors safely across the ocean...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Behold, gentlemen.\nThe fruit of prayer has been borne.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['That foreboding headwind...flipped\nto a tailwind! Without a doubt, this\nis a blessing of the gods...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['At this time of year, if it gets warmer,\nthe direction of the wind changes.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Thankfully it changed right\nin the middle of my prayer!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["The weather should be fine\nfrom now. They'll have a safe\nvoyage, no doubt about that.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['It takes more than just prayer\nto get the job done. I need\nto draw on all my wits, too.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Relying on prayer too much\ndispleases the the gods.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Well then, let's go see off the ship.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Pardon me.\nI don't know how to tell you this, but...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["The ship you blessed...\nIt hasn't returned.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Not only did I pray, but there wasn't\neven a hint of a storm to be seen...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['A piece of the shipwreck\nwashed up near Grandport.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['It seems the ship sunk\nsomewhere beyond the harbor.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['There have been a number of\nunfortunate occurrences this year.\nYou were the one hope we had, but...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['The sailors are talking...\nThey want to go back to\nthe old tradition: sacrifice.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You mustn't!\nThe gods take no pleasure in such rituals.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['The ship sank even with your blessing.\nI have no choice.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["There's something fishy about this.\nThere must be some reason\nother than weather and waves...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["If we don't get to the bottom of this\nand clear my name, we'll be forced\nto revert to the old ways.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['How about we talk to the townspeople\nand see what we can find?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Yet another ship's been sunk...\nIs Giacomo the only one unaffected?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["The very same. He's got a ship of\nhis own and transports cargo too.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["That guy's the only one prospering lately.\nHe's been drinking at the tavern all day.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['So only his ship has escaped misfortune...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["All right,\nlet's go check out the tavern.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Bahahah, drink up, drink up!\nPlenty to go around!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Hnn...?\nYou? Still hanging around this town, eh?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Oho, we've got no need\nfor your blessings here.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...I like my ship to stay afloat, thanks!\nBahahahahaha!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['What was that?\nSniffing around like a dog now, are you?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Did you notice?\nThat bar has an unusually\nstrong smell of saltwater.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['That rum they were drinking...\nCould it be from a barrel\ndragged out of the ocean?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["He's definitely suspicious...\nI'll see if I can't find evidence against him.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["The number of sinking\nships hasn't decreased...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["What's more... It seems that cargo\nis disappearing from the shipwrecks.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["And I can't shake my suspicions of Giacomo...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Every time a ship disappears,\nhe suddenly has the means to\nthrow an extravagant party.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['It must be he who sinks the ships,\nthen robs them of their cargo.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["But if that's the case, then...\nWhere is the cargo being kept?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['It must be somewhere in town...\nNo, <i>outside</> of town. There must\nbe a place it can be stored.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["There's a cave on the coast\nsaid to connect to the sea.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["It's dangerous and easy to get\ntrapped inside, so usually no\none goes near it, but...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['The other day, someone said\nthey saw folks going inside.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["If it's the same cave you're talking\nabout, I heard something as well.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Radiant Reefs on the North Rippletide Coast!\n...Let's go!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["This...this must be\nthe sunken ships' cargo!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Sticking your insolent nose\nwhere it doesn't belong...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Making these look like accidents...\nYou must have gone out of your way\nto plan all this...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['It was a lot of work at first, but...\nno one in the town suspects me.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Competition is low, the supply of\ncargo is endless, and I'm getting\nmore and more work.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["And if something were to befall\nyou, too, there'd be nothing in\nthe way of my prospering!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["It's what happens\nwhen you anger the gods.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["The cargo's in decent shape.\nLet's redistribute it to the townsfolk.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["So all those sunken ships\nwas all Giacomo's doing...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Thank you for recovering the lost cargo.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Don't worry about it. This was all\npart of safeguarding people's voyages.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Good cleric, I'm so sorry to\ntrouble you further, but could\nI get you to give us a blessing?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Aelfric, bringer of the Sacred Flame...\nBifelgan, god of wind and Trade...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['May the Sacred Flame and\nwind guide this ship and\nits sailors safely across the ocean...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['The gods have blessed our voyage!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["With prayer to ward off evil and\nknowledge to avoid natural disasters,\nI've ensured your safety doubly!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Thank you. Because of you, I was\nable to put an end to all this.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['It must be the guidance of\nthe Sacred Flame that brought us together.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Now it's my chance to help <i>you</>,\n<clan_name>!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...The seat next to me?\nSure, by all means.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Pleasure to meet you.\nI am Cedric, a traveling cleric.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You can sit next to me if you want.\nGo on, don't be shy.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I heard the exotic dances of the\nSunlands are a sight to see,\nso I came here out of curiosity.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...Although I feel a little\nout of place with all the, er...\noverenthusiastic gentlemen.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'll take center.\nYou should head backstage.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Helgenish! You did well\nwith that Primrose girl!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Such poise! She never missed a step!\nI only wish I could say the same for\nthe other dancers...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I agree. They've been terrible\nlately, and I refuse to pay for\nsuch a disappointing show!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["My apologies, good patrons.\nI'll be sure they are fully\ndisciplined by the next showing.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['You there.\nMight you be...a man of the cloth?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['You have heard of me.\nI am honored.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I have something to ask of you, Cedric.\nStop by the dancers' quarters later.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I've been waiting for you.\nCome inside.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Just a mild sprain.\nBut she should rest until it heals.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['A mild sprain. <i>A mild sprain</>!?\nYour weak ankles are driving off my clientele!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['F-forgive me, Master.\nI tried to keep going,\nbut it hurts so much that—', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You're a <i>dancer</>, damn you!\nYour art is dancing until your feet bleed!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["B-but, Master, something is wrong.\nWe've not gone a day without\nsomeone falling ill or injured.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['The others whisper of a foreboding aura...\nWe fear the stage is bewitched, Master!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Delusional, the lot of you! I could have\nyou lazy heifers replaced in a wink.\nIs that what you want!?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Bewitched... Bah! You should learn\nfrom Primrose! No injuries!\nNot a single bruise on her!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['How many times do\nI have to tell you girls!?\nNo outside visitors!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Apologies for flouting the rules,\nMaster, but I brought someone\nwho may be able to help.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['This cleric could bless the theatre.\nLift all maledictions and put the girls\nat ease so we can focus on our routines.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Indeed. I would be happy to\nperform a purification ritual.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I would feel much better if he did...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['If Master Helgenish is agreeable...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["But I'll not pay a single leaf\nfor this quack to humor your\nsilly superstitions!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Thank you, Cedric.\nI knew you would be\nkind enough to help us.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['You had a look of pure sympathy\non your face the moment she fell.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Quite observant of you,\nwhile dancing on stage no less.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['There is no need to thank me.\nIt is my solemn duty to provide\nsuccor to the suffering.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Let us prepare for the ritual.\nA proper blessing requires a few items.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["First, we'll need candles and lanterns...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["The tavern has plenty to spare!\nI'd be happy to bring them for you!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Excellent. And since we\nare in the Sunlands, we will\nuse cinnabar as a conduit.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["It's a bright red mineral often crushed\ninto pigment. But it's not commonly\nsold in the markets of Sunshade.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['We will have to forage for it in\nthe wild. Giant scorpions tend to\nmake their nests near the deposits.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...Which makes the task all\nthe more dangerous.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['You would escort me?\nThat would be wonderful.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Thank you. Let us not waste\nany time, then. To the desert!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['This seems to be the place\nPrimrose was talking about...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...This should be\nenough for the ritual.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['A giant scorpion!\nBe careful of its stinger!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['That was close.\nI am lucky to have you\nwith me on this trek.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["But we've agitated their nesting grounds.\nLet's get out of here before more attack.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['All right. Place the piles\nof crushed cinnabar on the\nfar corners of the stage.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['In ancient times, it was said the\nscarlet hue of cinnabar had the\npower to dispel wicked auras—', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Spare us the codswallop and get\nthis over with! You'd better be off\nthis stage by opening, holy man!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Hmph. She must think she's\ndoing us a big favor with this.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I will now perform the service.\nThe lantern, please.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['O mystic divinity,\ndrawn in the desert sands...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Bless thy humble coryphée,\nwho dance alone in darkness...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['We raise the flickering Flame,\nin guise of fair Sealticge,\nand burn away this profane shadow!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Wow... My body feels lighter!\nLike a feather!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['The air has changed.\nIt tastes crisper, cleaner than before!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['The ritual worked!\nIt really worked!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['May the Sacred Flame ever\nshine its warmth upon you...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Wait, please.\nLet us repay you for your kindness.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["We don't have much in the way\nof coin, but perhaps some bubbly\nlibations would suffice?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I appreciate the offer, but I am\nquite exhausted. I think I will\nretire for the night.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...How about you?\nCare to join our little party?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Yes, let's celebrate!\nAfter all, the nights\nare longer in Sunshade...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Your cohorts seem much rejuvenated.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['You have done a great deed for us, Cedric.\nWe are very grateful.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I do not have much\nI can offer you, but...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Actually, in lieu of payment,\nI would like to ask you for information.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Would you happen to know\nwhere I can find a desert rose?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Planning to give them to someone?\nHow lovely.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I hear you can find\nthem near the oasis.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["But I must admit,\nyou didn't strike me as the\ntype to have a sweetheart.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['She is no longer with us.\nShe passed away in the war.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['She loved desert roses.\nI should like to give her one\nto put her soul at ease.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['She is lucky to have had\nsomeone who cherishes her\nso long after she passed on.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Primrose,\nMaster is asking for you.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I hope you find your desert rose.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I think I will head\nover to the oasis.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['But I would feel safer\nif you came with me.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Is this your first time seeing one?\nI suppose the name is a bit misleading,\ngiven they are a type of ore.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['But see how the folds look\nsimilar to rose petals?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['My beloved favored these dearly...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['She was a ceremonial dancer\nfor the Sacred Flame in the\nKingdom of Hornburg.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I had been dispatched to the\nkingdom from Flamesgrace.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["The moment I saw her emotional\ndance of devotion in the cathedral,\nI couldn't help but fall in love.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['But five years ago...\ncivil war tore Hornburg apart.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I swore I would protect her until\nthe end. But the raging flames of\nwar pried her hand away from mine...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Sir, are you all right?\n...What a terrible wound!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['My name is Carl...\nPlease, you have to help me!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['You two, out of the way!\nThat man is a deserter from the Edoras army!\nHe must be put to death for his crimes!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I cannot allow you to do that!\nPlease, spare this man's life...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Filthy deserters like him don't\ndeserve any mercy! We cannot\ntolerate any display of weakness!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I will <i>not</> yield! I refuse to\nby and witness another pointless\nsacrifice in the name of war!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You've been through a lot, haven't you?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["We'd better get him out of the\nsun and away from those soldiers.\nLet's take him to town with us.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...Perhaps Primrose would be kind\nenough to offer him a place to rest?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I've done all I can.\nIt's up to him now.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["But...does Helgenish know you're hiding\na soldier in the dancers' quarters?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Let's not speak about this in front of him.\nI'll stop by your shop later.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["It's no trouble at all.\nYou helped the girls\nget back on their feet.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['But it would be best\nif he did not linger long.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Edoras men sent after deserters are as\ninsatiable as hounds after prized quarry.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I understand.\nHe just needs to rest\nand regain his strength.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Let us hope those dogs lose your\nscent before long. In the meantime,\nI'll do what I can to help.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['You have been a great help as well.\nIn truth, I feel a bit useless in all this.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['...Well, I can pray. And I will recite the\nstrongest canticles I know for the\nSacred Flame to protect him.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['You were touch and go for a while,\nbut looks like you pulled through.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Cleric, I wish to repent for my sins.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['As a soldier, I had been ordered to kill so\nmany people. And not just enemy soldiers...\nbut innocents as well.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I was haunted by these horrendous\ndeeds. I sought to escape the\nvicious cycle I was in...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['You were alone when we found you.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["...That's right.\nHer hand slipped away\nfrom mine in the pursuit...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Don't worry.\nI am sure she found a way to survive.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Please, you must find her!\nShe's still out there! Her name is Tabitha!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Wait, Carl!\nDid you say her name is Tabitha!?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Enough. He's asleep.\nBest leave him be for now.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Is something wrong?\nYou look as if you've seen a ghost.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Excuse me, miss!\nMight you be Tabitha?\nHer hair, she looks so much like...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Carl's still alive!?\nYou rescued him!?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Carl is in hiding in Sunshade.\nI will take you to him.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I promised I would protect you, but...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Easy, now.\nWhat matters is you've come back to me.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['O Aelfric.\nIs this truly your will?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Thanks to you, I was\nreunited with my husband.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['This is nothing less than a miracle.\nI thought you were dead.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Forgive me.\nFor abandoning hope so soon...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['You have nothing to apologize for.\nHornburg was hell last we met.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I was taken away by enemy soldiers.\nThey took everything from me but my life.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I had been handed around by\nthose blackguards until I broke\nfree and drifted to Edoras.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Both of us had been suffering from\ngrievous wounds on our hearts and bodies.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['The army made Carl do such\ndespicable things... Even beat his\nown mother for disobeying the law...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['We overcame our demons and\nlearned how to heal...together.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Cedric, if I had known you survived...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["What's past is past. You had\neach other at a time you both\nneeded the other most.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['He is.\nA better man than I deserve.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
